title_sort: john j. barker to walt whitman, 5 june 1863
title: John J. Barker to Walt Whitman, 5 June 1863
text: Dear friendI have the present opertunity[opportunity] to drop you a few lines to let you now that I am well and have got safe to the regment[regiment] and I have bin[been] to see my famley they are well wee[we] are all m[o]unted an wee[we] have got the pras[praise] of the finest regment[regiment] in these pats My Capten Skaggs is ded[dead] brother william[William] is very lowi[I]dont[don't] think that he will live but 3 or foar[four] days wee[we] think we will cros[cross] the Cumbrlen river in a few days wee[we] have got plontloon[pontoon] & boats in a larg[large] foars[fours] in an a bout here most of them is mounted intfery[infantry] an cavelry[cavalry] wee[we] think wee[we] will make a gard[guard] on nxvill [Knoxville?] excuse bad riten[written] an short leter[letter] yours rspectivly[respectively]Direct your leter[letter] to Co E 2 tennossee[Tennessee] regment[regiment] Conal[Colonel] Carter Commanding John J. Barker to Walt Whitman, 5 June 1863
